In this section, Chaim Grade discusses various topics related to Yiddish literature, including encounters with Soviet Yiddish writers, dramatic poems, motives in his works, Young Vilna, the return to Zion, the Sabbath in Yiddish literature, Mussarists and Lithuanian Yeshivas, and Sholem Aleichem. The topics covered in the curr_chunk include lectures and essays on Jewish life worldwide, Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia, Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman, Song of Songs, Saffed and Mount Miron, the greening of Israel, Vilna's uniqueness, Histadruth, and Yiddish life in Vilna during World War II. In the curr_chunk, Chaim Grade discusses various lectures and essays on Jewish life worldwide, Yiddish literature in Vilna before World War II, the new Hebrew literature in Israel, the survivors of the German concentration camps, the soil and legend of the Land of Israel, and controversies among the rabbis of Vilna. Chaim Grade discusses various lectures and essays on Jewish life worldwide, Yiddish literature in Vilna before World War II, new Hebrew literature in Israel, survivors of German concentration camps, and works by American Yiddish poets Morris Rosenfeld, Avrohom Reisen, Walt-Lessin, and Mani Leib. Additionally, any other works by Chaim Grade, whether published or unpublished, are also included.
